NAM Briefing by Email October To NAM Members From Doug Kurkul NAM Assistant Vice President Member Communications Todays Briefing brings you the latest information on issues affecting your bottom line including tax legislation USCanada border issues and trade promotion authority Read todays issue at briefingnewsletter Link not working properly Sometimes links are broken when they are transmitted via email or if your email program does not support hyperlinks When this happens we suggest you copy and paste the URL into your browser This way you can get the whole link as sometimes it carries over onto the next line When you do this make sure there are no spaces in the link

NAM Special Recess Edition of Capitol NewsOLEObj National Association of Manufacturers November NAM MEMBERS RECESS MESSAGE TO CONGRESS The House and Senate are in recess this week and will return Monday Please contact your legislators and urge them to take action on the following issues by calling the Capitol switchboard at The House is expected to vote on trade promotion authority Labor is fighting hard and it is urgent you tell your representative you need TPA passed For details click here wwwnamorgtpatoolkit tpatoolkit Quick legislative action on an aggressive economicstimulus plan is necessary A stimulus plan must include the proposals outlined by President Bush For details click here wwwnamorgeconomytoolkit economytoolkit Please encourage your senator to persuade the Senate Leadership to set a date certain to debate and approve comprehensive energy legislation Congress must act as soon as possible on legislation to stabilize the insurance market by creating a federal backstop for terrorism insurance coverage Additional information is available in our Briefing enewsletter at wwwnamorgbriefingnewsletter briefingnewsletter To receive a free membersonly subscription to this enewsletter NAM Capitol News published every TuesdayFriday during congressional sessions email your request to mailto MAJOR IMPROVEMENTS AS NAM OSHA SETTLE LAWSUIT OVER RULE The NAM and the Labor Dept DOL on settled the NAMs lawsuit challenging OSHAs recordkeeping rule It takes effect The agreement requires DOL to inform its enforcement officers nationwide of the meaning of several critical provisions OSHA will not issue citations for rule violations during the first days provided the employer attempts in good faith to meet its obligations and agrees to make corrections To view our press statement click wwwnamorgtertiaryaspTrackIDCategoryIDDocumentID tertiaryaspTrackIDCategoryIDDocumentID PRESIDENT SIGNS STOPGAP BILL TO CONTINUE FUNDING THROUGH President Bush signed into law the fifth spending resolution of FY to keep unfunded government departments and agencies operating through Five of the annual spending bills have been signed into law Congress has sent three others to the President for his signature But five are unfinished TERRORISM INSURANCE BILL MAY REACH WHITE HOUSE BY DECEMBER Terrorism insurance bill HR will pass the House next week be reconciled with the Senate and be signed by President Bush in December said House Majority Leader Dick Armey RTX The Ways and Means Committee on amended the bill to eliminate provisions that would permit the insurance industry to accumulate taxfree reserves as a bulwark against losses resulting from possible future terrorist actions The NAM is urging Congress to finalize action soon on a bill to stabilize the insurance market TRADE PROMOTION AUTHORITY VOTE EXPECTED DECEMBER A House vote is expected on NAMbacked bipartisan TPA bill HR Many undecided lawmakers are saying theyll vote for TPA if they hear more from business Your contacts with undecided lawmakers are urgently needed Encourage your employees to do the same Our TPA toolkit wwwnamorgtpatoolkit tpatoolkit has everything you need the list of undecided lawmakers talking points sample faxes etc YOUR INPUT NEEDED ON EPA PROPOSED NAAQS RULE The NAMindustry lawsuit challenging EPAs particulate matter and ozone rules prompted a federal court to send the ozone rule back to the agency to consider the beneficial health effects of ozone EPA proposed a new rule but said theres not enough evidence to relax the parts per million level in the rule Wed like you to review the rule and provide feedback before the comment deadline It can be viewed at wwwnamorgrer rer click Air Quality Issues then NAAQS FSCETI ORAL ARGUMENTS NEXT WEEK On Dep Treasury Sec Kenneth Dam and Justice Dept attorney Kent Jones will present oral arguments in defense of the ETI tax program formerly the FSC program before a WTO disputesettlement appeals panel US and EU officials seek to avoid a trade confrontation and may look to the new WTO round as a vehicle for resolving differences Rules approved at the Doha ministerial meeting this week would be broad enough to accommodate a solution if the two sides can agree NEWS IN BRIEF Reps Bill Thomas RCA and Charles Rangel DNY said yesterday that they favor a plan to suspend Social Security payroll taxes for one month Arkansas voters today will choose between state Rep Mike Hathorn D and optometrist John Boozman R to replace exRep Asa Hutchinson RAR Gov Howard Dean DVT has taken the first step toward a possible presidential bid by forming a federal PAC State Rep James Durkin RIL yesterday announced his candidacy for the GOP Senate nomination Houston City Councilman Carroll Robinson D yesterday became a candidate for Senate candidate Rep Ken Bentsens DTX redrawn House seat Rep Tom Lantos DCA announced yesterday he plans to run for reelection President Bush will meet today with Philippine President Gloria Macapagal Arroyo at the White House For additional information on the issues covered in this report contact Doug Kurkul Tim Lugbill or Grant Cole at in the NAMs Member Communications Department Copyright National Association of Manufacturers Capitol News is available online Click here membersecondaryaspTrackIDCategoryID to view online To unsubscribe email Jim Sonick mailto

NAM Special Recess Edition of BriefingTo NAM Members From Doug Kurkul Todays special recess edition of Briefing highlights four policy issues that require your immediate action economic stimulus trade promotion authority terrorist reinsurance and comprehensive energy legislation Other issues affecting your bottom line featured include OSHA recordkeeping agribusiness antitrust Internet tax moratorium and more If youre not already a Briefing by Email subscriber but want to be added to our list email mailto Briefing by Email is published weekly when Congress is in session The next edition will be published Friday November Read todays issue at briefingnewsletter Link not working properly Sometimes links are broken when they are transmitted via email or if your email program does not support hyperlinks When this happens we suggest you copy and paste the URL into your browser This way you can get the whole link as sometimes it carries over onto the next line When you do this make sure there are no spaces in the link
